bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 22, 1924

div1.p: Read refers to investigations made in connection with yellow fever in the Gold Coast, Africa.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, January 22, 1924
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
January 22, 1924
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a letter from Sir
Herbert Read dated November 12, 1923, transmitting the re-
port of Dr. Maplestone, assistant director of the Sir Alfred
Lewis Jones Research Laboratory at Sierra Leone, West Africa,
on certain investigations which he made in connection with
yellow fever in the Gold Coast Colony. Copy of Dr. Maple-
stone's report is also enclosed.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor Henry R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington
District of Columbia
FMR:EO 2E
